availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Ellis (Casey Co, KY, 1st ky cavalry regiment)

body.p: Casey County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Berrel Ellis and Sarah Ellis. Married to Mary M. Cooper Ellis in Lincoln County, Kentucky, on June 27, 1865. Resident in Casey County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private from July 23, 1861, to December 22, 1863. Served in the 13th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a first lieutenant.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Casey County, District 1, p. 401.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Pendleton County Marriages, Film #001904136, p. 114.
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 1, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 8-9.
KYR-0002-033-0028.
